Dr. Toast live at NASA Ames

posted March 19, 2007 | music, shows

Friday, April 13, 2007 @ 6pm - Dr. Toast spins a live downtempo laptop set in an aircraft hangar at NASA! Yuri's Night is a celebration of the anniversary of the first human spaceflight with a fusion of art, science, music, and dance. The lineup also includes Plaid, Telefon Tel Aviv, Bluetech, Sutekh, Ooah+Boreta, Mr. Projectile+Spacetime Continuum, RD, Welder, Mozaic, and the Space Cowboys Unimog! http://worldspaceparty.com/sounds.php

Charles Kaufman's Toaster Paintings

posted January 8, 2007 | toast-links, toasters

Charles Kaufman paints toasters in surrealistic settings. The prevailing kinetic gestures evoke a dynamicism that transcends the too-often static familiarity of breakfast. Rating:

Roller Toaster

posted November 29, 2006 | toasters

Industrial designer Jaren Goh's new Roller Toaster represents a major advance in modern toasting mechanics.Â  It smoothly pulls in the bread, wrings out all the un-toasted-ness, and drops the hot, crispy result onto your plate.

Toast Leaners' Club

posted November 15, 2006 | toast-links

From the Toast Leaners' Club website: "Why lean toast? One might equally ask "Why breathe?", "Why live?" or "Why exist?". To cool toast with such joyous efficiency is to take delight in each crunchy bite, each crisp morsel, and repel the evils of toast with a soggy underside or sodden with molten margarine." Rating: Pictured below: a "basic two-slice lean".

Toast Printer

posted October 10, 2006 | toasters

The Zuse toaster allows you to burn custom images into your toast. I envision a future where internet-connected toasters will be available for free, paid for by the advertising that arrives fresh, hot and crispy on your plate.

Toaster Guitar Amps

posted September 29, 2006 | toast-links, toasters

Hottie Amps sells toasters that have been converted into mini guitar amps! And for a small fee, they'll transform your favorite toaster into the most rocking appliance in your whole kitchen!

Toast Art

posted September 25, 2006 | toast-links

A few slices of bread, a blowtorch, sandpaper, drills, paint... That's all Lennie Payne needs to make beautiful toast portraits!

Dr. Toast Live at Equity

posted August 7, 2006 | music, shows

Wednesday, August 9, 2006 5-9pm - The False Profit Happy Hour @ Il Pirata (2007 16th St @ Potrero). "Strong drinks, hot pizza, good Italian food, and an outdoor patio... Plus laptops, glitch-hop, breaks, and bass to soothe the rat race. Throw something in the tip jar and start building Equity today." Dr. Toast, Maer, and Bertzerker. http://false-profit.com/equity

Toaster Radio!

posted August 7, 2006 | toasters

For thousands of years we have had clock radios, toaster ovens, ovens with clocks.... but why not a toaster with a radio built in? Finally, such a thing has come to pass. I only wish they had taken it to the next logical step - a toaster alarm clock radio, gently waking you with the comforting smell of fresh toast. But then, perhaps sleepily reaching for the snooze alarm and thusly putting your fumbly digits in a burning hot toaster might not be so good.
